p: Dengue is a mosquito-borne disease, in which Aedes aegypti is the main vector. This type of mosquito is commonly found in tropical countries. Dengue fever (DF) and dengue hemorrhagic fever (DHF), a severe form of the disease, are caused by four dengue serotypes represented by DEN 1, 2, 3, and 4 [ 1â€“ 4]. Reinfections of different serotypes can cause severe illnesses or deaths.
